title: Sellers shun housing market as Brexit rhetoric heats up
text:
Homeowners looking to sell their property are shunning the market amid political turmoil over Brexit – dragging new listings down to a three-year low.

The housing market stumbled again in September as new sales fell to within a whisker of their lowest level since the European Union referendum, according to the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS).

Its new listings gauge dropped back to -37pc, meaning more agents reported a fall in the number of properties coming onto the market than said they had seen an increase, the weakest reading since June 2016. Enquiries from new buyers also tumbled back into negative territory.

The survey found that both buyers and sellers are showing caution as...
description: Homeowners looking to sell their property are shunning the market amid political turmoil over Brexit – dragging new listings down to a three-year low.
